[14:28:13.65] DB[4] > SELECT full_path, name, type, sync_type, hide, fld_order, id_parent, flags FROM em_awm_folders
					WHERE id_acct = 1 AND id_folder = 5
[14:28:13.65] DB[5] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 1
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order

[14:28:18.12] DB[3] > SELECT full_path, name, type, sync_type, hide, fld_order, id_parent, flags FROM em_awm_folders
					WHERE id_acct = 1 AND id_folder = 1
[14:28:18.12] DB[4] > SELECT full_path, name, type, sync_type, hide, fld_order, id_parent, flags FROM em_awm_folders
					WHERE id_acct = 1 AND id_folder = 5
[14:28:18.12] DB[5] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 1
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order

[14:36:59.37] DB[4] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 1
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order
[14:36:59.38] DB[5] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 1
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order

[14:37:03.47] DB[2] > SELECT `id_user`, `msgs_per_page`, `contacts_per_page`, `auto_checkmail_interval`, `last_login`, `logins_count`, `def_skin`, `def_lang`, `def_editor`, `save_mail`, `layout`, `incoming_charset`, `def_timezone`, `def_time_fmt`, `def_date_fmt`, `client_timeoffset`, `question_1`, `question_2`, `answer_1`, `answer_2`, `capa`, `custom_fields` FROM em_awm_settings WHERE `id_user` = 1
[14:37:03.48] DB[3] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 1
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order

[14:37:03.95] IMAP4 < 2012 was an incredible year. We released Unity 3.5 and Unity 4, expanded to 4 continents with a total of 13 offices and grew to over 1.5 million users. Thank you for taking Unity all around the world! The quality, variety and innovation of games and other interactive content made with Unity in 2012 inspires us to continuously improve our technology and tools.\r\n
[14:37:03.95] IMAP4 < Thats why just days after the release of Unity 4, developers from our regional offices joined their colleagues in Copenhagen. After the crunch of release they recharged with the experimental jamming of Ninja Camp VII. As VP Engineering, Lucas Meijer, says Ninja Camp is our chance to develop in a really creative, but focused way.\r\n
[14:37:03.95] IMAP4 < Read on to learn about some of the projects from Ninja Camp VII, whats coming up on the Mecanim roadmap, and as always, links to new games, great resources and more!\r\n

[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 < ><img style="display: block; height: 150px;" src="http://info.unity3d.com/rs/unity3d/images/nsNovember.jpg" border="0" alt="December Newsletter" width="548" height="150" /></a>\r\n
[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 < <div><span style="font-size: 10px;">&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n
[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 < <div style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 18px; color: #222; font-weight: bold;">Dear Unity Developers,</div>\r\n
[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 < <a style="color: #5284bd; text-decoration: underline;" target="_blank"></a>\r\n
[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 < <p style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px; color: #444; line-height: 17px;">2012 was an incredible year.\r\n
[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 <    We released Unity 3.5 and Unity 4, expanded to 4 continents with a total of 13 offices and grew to over 1.5 million users.\r\n
[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 <    Thank you for taking Unity all around the world! The quality, variety and innovation of games and other interactive content made with Unity in 2012 inspires us to continuously improve our technology and tools.</p>\r\n
[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 < <p style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px; color: #444; line-height: 17px;">That&rsquo;s why just days after the release of Unity 4, developers from our regional offices joined their colleagues in Copenhagen.\r\n
[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 <    After the crunch of release they recharged with the experimental jamming of Ninja Camp VII.\r\n
[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 <    As our VP Engineering, Lucas Meijer, says &ldquo;Ninja Camp is our chance to develop in a really creative, but focused way".</p>\r\n
[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 < <p style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px; color: #444; line-height: 17px;">Read on to learn about some of the projects from Ninja Camp VII, what&rsquo;s coming up on the Mecanim roadmap, and as always, links to new games, great resources and more!</p>\r\n
[14:37:03.97] IMAP4 < </td>\r\n

[14:37:10.44] IMAP4 < \r\n
[14:37:10.44] IMAP4 < When a creative idea crystallizes, the writer rushes to her paper and the painter to his canvas. The artists at Massive Black turned to Unity to rapidly bring to life their vision for Mothhead <http://unity3d.com/promo/mothhead/>. Unity is ubiquitous in game development today because everyone digs how they can both unleash and focus their creative freedom and passion <http://www.develop-online.net/features/1729/Box-Clever-Peter-Molyneux-on-Unity> with it.\r\n
[14:37:10.44] IMAP4 < Whats amazing to see is the role of the Unity Community in making the creative process more joyous and less lonesome. When Obsidian Entertainment announced their choice of Unity for their Kickstarter-funded Project Eternity, the studio was flooded with offers of help from Unity developers and artists. In an interview with gamesindustry International, the studio's creative director Chris Avellone says It just feels like a rare option in the industry, the amount of people willing to just come on board and just pitch in because they know the engine and the technology.\r\n
[14:37:10.44] IMAP4 < Keep reading to learn about the Mothhead demo for artists, Asset Store offers, Unity developer hangouts, and the latest games.\r\n

[14:37:10.44] IMAP4 < More games, more platforms--Union now supports 7 platforms including Intel Atom Android devices. To date, Union has released more than 50 games on these platforms, with more on the way. Notably, the LG smart TV version of Frisbee Forever was recently featured in a TV commercial starring popular Korean group Girls Generation! Check out Union's website <http://unity3d.com/union/> for more information and details on how to submit a game.\r\n

[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < <td width="25"><span style="font-size: 1px;">&nbsp;</span></td>\r\n
[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < <td width="367" align="left" valign="top">\r\n
[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < <div style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 18px; color: #222; font-weight: bold;">Dear Unity Developers,</div>\r\n
[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < <a style="color: #5284bd; text-decoration: underline;" target="_blank"></a>\r\n
[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < <p style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px; color: #444; line-height: 17px;">When a creative idea crystallizes, the writer rushes to her paper and the painter to his canvas. The artists at Massive Black turned to Unity to rapidly bring to life their vision for <a style="color: #5284bd; text-decoration: underline;" href=\r\n
[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < "http://news.unity3d.com/track?type=click&enid=bWFpbGluZ2lkPXVuaXR5M2RCZXRhY3VzdC0yMDI5LTI2NTAtMC0yNDE3LXByb2QtMTk4NyZtZXNzYWdlaWQ9MCZkYXRhYmFzZWlkPTE5ODcmc2VyaWFsPTEyOTk2MDQ1NjAmZW1haWxpZD1pbmZvQGdhbWVtYXN0ZXJzLmlyJnVzZXJpZD0xNDMzMTY0NS0xJmV4dHJhPSYmJg==&&&http://unity3d.com/promo/mothhead/?mkt_tok=3RkMMJWWfF9wsRoku67AZKXonjHpfsX57%2B8uWKGyh4kz2EFye%2BLIHETpodcMTsZjMq%2BNFAAgAZVnyRQFD%2B6caJkT%2Fg%3D%3D" target="_blank"\r\n
[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < ><span style="color: #5284bd;">Mothhead</span></a>. Unity is ubiquitous in game development today because everyone digs how they can both unleash and focus their <a style="color: #5284bd; text-decoration: underline;" href=\r\n
[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < "http://news.unity3d.com/track?type=click&enid=bWFpbGluZ2lkPXVuaXR5M2RCZXRhY3VzdC0yMDI5LTI2NTAtMC0yNDE3LXByb2QtMTk4NyZtZXNzYWdlaWQ9MCZkYXRhYmFzZWlkPTE5ODcmc2VyaWFsPTEyOTk2MDQ1NjAmZW1haWxpZD1pbmZvQGdhbWVtYXN0ZXJzLmlyJnVzZXJpZD0xNDMzMTY0NS0xJmV4dHJhPSYmJg==&&&http://www.develop-online.net/features/1729/Box-Clever-Peter-Molyneux-on-Unity?mkt_tok=3RkMMJWWfF9wsRoku67AZKXonjHpfsX57%2B8uWKGyh4kz2EFye%2BLIHETpodcMTsZjMq%2BNFAAgAZVnyRQFD%2B6caJkT%2Fg%3D%3D" target="_blank"\r\n
[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < ><span style="color: #5284bd;">creative freedom and passion</span></a> with it.</p>\r\n
[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < <p style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px; color: #444; line-height: 17px;">What&rsquo;s amazing to see is the role of the Unity Community in making the creative process more joyous and less lonesome. When Obsidian Entertainment announced their choice of Unity for their Kickstarter-funded Project Eternity, the studio was flooded with offers of help from Unity developers and artists. In an interview with gamesindustry International, the studio's creative director Chris Avellone says &ldquo;It just feels like a rare option in the industry, the amount of people willing to just come on board and just pitch in because they know the engine and the technology.&rdquo;</p>\r\n
[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < <p style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px; color: #444; line-height: 17px;">Keep reading to learn about the Mothhead demo for artists, Asset Store offers, Unity developer hangouts, and the latest games.</p>\r\n
[14:37:10.45] IMAP4 < </td>\r\n

[14:37:10.46] IMAP4 < <div style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 14px; color: #444; font-weight: bold;">Hangout with our devs on Google + and post your questions</div>\r\n
[14:37:10.46] IMAP4 < <p style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px; color: #444; line-height: 17px;">Once a month, a bunch of Unity developers get together to hold a live video chat to answer questions from viewers. The monthly Unity developer hangouts are set up via Google +. Viewers can post their questions in the comments field during the video chat, and each session is automatically recorded and uploaded to our Unity channel on Youtube.</p>\r\n
[14:37:10.46] IMAP4 < <p style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px; color: #444; line-height: 17px;">You can view the latest hangout session <a style="color: #5284bd; text-decoration: underline;" href=\r\n

[14:44:18.22] DB[6] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 2
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order

	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 2
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order

[15:24:07.14] DB[4] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 2
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order
[15:24:07.14] DB[5] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 2
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order

[15:24:52.42] DB[3] > SELECT `id_user`, `msgs_per_page`, `contacts_per_page`, `auto_checkmail_interval`, `last_login`, `logins_count`, `def_skin`, `def_lang`, `def_editor`, `save_mail`, `layout`, `incoming_charset`, `def_timezone`, `def_time_fmt`, `def_date_fmt`, `client_timeoffset`, `question_1`, `question_2`, `answer_1`, `answer_2`, `capa`, `custom_fields` FROM em_awm_settings WHERE `id_user` = 2
[15:24:52.43] DB[4] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 2
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order

[15:25:10.22] DB[4] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 1
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order
[15:25:10.22] DB[5] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 1
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order

[15:25:11.94] DB[6] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 1
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order

[15:25:14.13] DB[2] > SELECT `id_user`, `msgs_per_page`, `contacts_per_page`, `auto_checkmail_interval`, `last_login`, `logins_count`, `def_skin`, `def_lang`, `def_editor`, `save_mail`, `layout`, `incoming_charset`, `def_timezone`, `def_time_fmt`, `def_date_fmt`, `client_timeoffset`, `question_1`, `question_2`, `answer_1`, `answer_2`, `capa`, `custom_fields` FROM em_awm_settings WHERE `id_user` = 1
[15:25:14.14] DB[3] > SELECT p.id_folder, p.id_parent, p.type, p.name, p.full_path, p.sync_type, p.hide, p.fld_order, p.flags,
	COUNT(messages.id) AS message_count, COUNT(messages_unread.seen) AS unread_message_count,
	SUM(messages.size) AS folder_size, MAX(folder_level) AS level
FROM (em_awm_folders as n, em_awm_folders_tree as t, em_awm_folders as p)
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages ON p.id_folder = messages.id_folder_db
LEFT OUTER JOIN em_awm_messages AS messages_unread ON
	p.id_folder = messages_unread.id_folder_db AND
	messages.id = messages_unread.id AND messages_unread.seen = 0
WHERE n.id_parent = -1
	AND n.id_folder = t.id_parent
	AND t.id_folder = p.id_folder
	AND p.id_acct = 1
GROUP BY p.id_folder
ORDER BY p.fld_order

[15:25:14.63] IMAP4 < \r\n
[15:25:14.63] IMAP4 < 2012 was an incredible year. We released Unity 3.5 and Unity 4, expanded to 4 continents with a total of 13 offices and grew to over 1.5 million users. Thank you for taking Unity all around the world! The quality, variety and innovation of games and other interactive content made with Unity in 2012 inspires us to continuously improve our technology and tools.\r\n
[15:25:14.63] IMAP4 < Thats why just days after the release of Unity 4, developers from our regional offices joined their colleagues in Copenhagen. After the crunch of release they recharged with the experimental jamming of Ninja Camp VII. As VP Engineering, Lucas Meijer, says Ninja Camp is our chance to develop in a really creative, but focused way.\r\n
[15:25:14.63] IMAP4 < Read on to learn about some of the projects from Ninja Camp VII, whats coming up on the Mecanim roadmap, and as always, links to new games, great resources and more!\r\n

[15:25:14.63] IMAP4 <  \r\n

[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 < ><img style="display: block; height: 150px;" src="http://info.unity3d.com/rs/unity3d/images/nsNovember.jpg" border="0" alt="December Newsletter" width="548" height="150" /></a>\r\n
[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 < <div><span style="font-size: 10px;">&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n
[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 < <div style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 18px; color: #222; font-weight: bold;">Dear Unity Developers,</div>\r\n
[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 < <a style="color: #5284bd; text-decoration: underline;" target="_blank"></a>\r\n
[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 < <p style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px; color: #444; line-height: 17px;">2012 was an incredible year.\r\n
[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 <    We released Unity 3.5 and Unity 4, expanded to 4 continents with a total of 13 offices and grew to over 1.5 million users.\r\n
[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 <    Thank you for taking Unity all around the world! The quality, variety and innovation of games and other interactive content made with Unity in 2012 inspires us to continuously improve our technology and tools.</p>\r\n
[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 < <p style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px; color: #444; line-height: 17px;">That&rsquo;s why just days after the release of Unity 4, developers from our regional offices joined their colleagues in Copenhagen.\r\n
[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 <    After the crunch of release they recharged with the experimental jamming of Ninja Camp VII.\r\n
[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 <    As our VP Engineering, Lucas Meijer, says &ldquo;Ninja Camp is our chance to develop in a really creative, but focused way".</p>\r\n
[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 < <p style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px; color: #444; line-height: 17px;">Read on to learn about some of the projects from Ninja Camp VII, what&rsquo;s coming up on the Mecanim roadmap, and as always, links to new games, great resources and more!</p>\r\n
[15:25:14.65] IMAP4 < </td>\r\n
